DOC.brief_summary: Symptomatic Gastroesophageal Reflux (GER) is considered by many a contraindication to laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy (LSG). However, of the few studies that have investigated the relationship between LSG and GER the majority reported only changes in symptoms and manometric data, while assessment of GER using 24-hour pH monitoring is lacking. The aim of this study is to evaluate the effect of LSG on GER in morbidly obese patients.
DOC.brief_title: Laparoscopic Sleeve Gastrectomy and Gastroesophageal Acid Reflux
DOC.detailed_description: Consecutive morbidly obese patients selected for LSG are included in a prospective clinical study. Gastroesophageal function is evaluated using a clinical validated questionnaire, upper endoscopy, esophageal manometry and 24-h pH monitoring before and 24 months after LSG.
DOC.criteria: history of obesity exceeding 5 years documented previous weight loss attempts, body mass index (BMI)) of 4050 kg/m2 age of 1860 years. contraindications to pneumoperitoneum large esophageal hiatal hernia pregnancy, drug or alcohol abuse, psychological disorders (e.g., bulimia, depression) hormonal or genetic obesityrelated disease, previous gastric surgery
